poem:
### The Mirror in the Room

In the postwar city,  
a mirror leans against the wall,  
reflecting a party—  
a mess of heavy drapery,  
glasses clinking, whispers,  
and the allure of entanglement.  
Beyond its frame,  
life turns  
in quiet arcs,  
left waiting for the rest of the tale  
to write itself  
in the breathing room.

At some point she found herself moved to continue the narrative, and so it became the first of the three chapters of what is now a novella. In my mind, these chapters resemble the mirrors you might find sitting on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
